replies.bodyText: It behaves like it used to be. When one prepare statement request fails and the failure would be also cached.
replies.author: BillyYccc

replies.bodyText: I wonder if we might want to improve this because caching failures such as syntax error, network failure, etc... does not help anything from the perspective of users.
replies.author: BillyYccc

replies.bodyText:
ok, I didn't remember this part.
However then it does not map correctly to the max prepared statement cache size because this cache size should account for valid statements I think. So perhaps we want to remove failure caching.
